import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import plotly.express as px
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.offline as py
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

#Code by Aishwarya Wuntkal https://www.kaggle.com/aishu2218/breast-cancer-prediction-using-svm/comments

trace = go.Pie(labels = ['Current','Past 1', 'Past 2', 'Past 3'], values = df['Phase of measure'].value_counts(), 
               textfont=dict(size=15), opacity = 0.8,
               marker=dict(colors=['red', 'orange','yellow', 'blue'], 
               line=dict(color='#000000', width=1.5)))
           

layout= go.Layout(
        title={
        'text': "Distribution of Phases of Measures",
        'y':0.9,
        'x':0.5,
        'xanchor': 'center',
        'yanchor': 'top'})

fig = go.Figure(data = [trace], layout=layout)
fig.show()
source.a93eded7:
#Code from Gabriel Preda
#plt.style.use('dark_background')
def plot_count(feature, title, df, size=1):
    f, ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(4*size,4))
    total = float(len(df))
    g = sns.countplot(df[feature], order = df[feature].value_counts().index[:20], palette='rainbow')
    g.set_title("Number and percentage of {}".format(title))
    if(size > 2):
        plt.xticks(rotation=90, size=8)
    for p in ax.patches:
        height = p.get_height()
        ax.text(p.get_x()+p.get_width()/2.,
                height + 3,
                '{:1.2f}%'.format(100*height/total),
                ha="center") 
    plt.show()
source.335ee118:
#Code from Gabriel Preda
#plt.style.use('dark_background')
def plot_count(feature, title, df, size=1):
    f, ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(4*size,4))
    total = float(len(df))
    g = sns.countplot(df[feature], order = df[feature].value_counts().index[:20], palette='Greens_r')
    g.set_title("Number and percentage of {}".format(title))
    if(size > 2):
        plt.xticks(rotation=90, size=8)
    for p in ax.patches:
        height = p.get_height()
        ax.text(p.get_x()+p.get_width()/2.,
                height + 3,
                '{:1.2f}%'.format(100*height/total),
                ha="center") 
    plt.show()

#Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

color = plt.cm.Set1(np.linspace(0,1,20))
df["NPI"].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=False).head(20).plot.pie(y="Phase of measure",colors=color,autopct="%0.1f%%")
plt.title("Non-Pharmaceutical Interventions Phases")
plt.axis("off")
plt.show()

source.1395060a:
##Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

from wordcloud import WordCloud
from wordcloud import STOPWORDS
stopwords = set(STOPWORDS)
wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color = 'black',
                      height =2000,
                      width = 2000,
                      colormap='ocean',
                     ).generate(str(df["Descriptions of detailed actions (including amendments or expansions of measures with dates)"]))
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12,12)
plt.axis("off")
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.title("")
plt.show()
